    • Method Detail

      • persist

        public static void persist(TrainingSession session,
                           javax.persistence.EntityManager dbManager)
        Persist a session to the database, ensuring all persistent members exist in the database already.
        Parameters:
        session - The training session to save to the database.

      • nextSample

        public MarketSample nextSample(javax.persistence.EntityManager dbManager,
                               MarketSynth marketSynth)
        Creates a new market sample if the training session is not complete. Otherwise, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        dbManager -
        marketSynth -
        Returns:
        The new market sample, or null if the training session was completed.

      • collectMarketUniverse

        public boolean collectMarketUniverse(javax.persistence.EntityManager dbManager,
                                     TwelvedataClient marketClient)
        In order to extract samples from historical market data, that population/universe from which the trade bars are taken needs to exist in the database. Note that this works with the assumption that universes will always be defined as an interval from a lookback to the present, so there are never any holes between the start and end datetimes. Note that ideal universe bounds won't necessarily match valid market calendars and market hours, so in cases where this is expected, the universe bounds after .. before will be updated to match what the database does have.
        Returns:
        true if the needed market data is now in the database.
